Question: How do you prefer to communicate (e.g., by phone, email, in person)?
Which social networks do you prefer to use (personally and professionally)?
How do you stay current on developments in your industry?
If you were to search for a product/service you needed, what search terms would you use?
Think back on a recent purchase. How did you research the purchase?

Think back on a recent purchase. How did you research the purchase? What factors were most important to you in evaluating your options? What doubts did you have? Did anyone help you make the final decision?
What do you watch on TV?
What offline resources do you use?
What online resources do you use?
Where do you prefer to do your shopping?
How important is it to get a good deal?
What types of mobile devices do you own?
What could make us even better? Whether it be in the buying process you went through or afterwards?
What could we do to reach more people just like you?
How often do you check emails on your phone, at home, at work?
Do you use the internet to research vendors or products? If yes, how do you search for information?
Describe a recent purchase.
What do you like to do in your free time?
If yes, which ones?
If no, why not? Are they unsure how to use them? Perhaps they don’t trust them?
What’s their preferred method of communication? Emailing, texting, using an app (such as WhatsApp), or do they prefer to pick up the phone?
Do they shop online?
If yes, which websites do they usually buy from?

If no, why not? As with Question #336, this may come down to trust (not feeling confident supplying their bank details online) or ability (not understanding how to make purchases online). However, they may simply prefer to make purchases in person.
Again if no, could they be persuaded to start shopping online?
What cell phone do they use?
Why do they need your product (or service)? Think about the benefits it will offer your specific buyer (not the general public at large).

When will they need your product? Is it something they’ll need for a specific occasion, something that lends itself to repeat purchases, or something that, while useful, will not be required at any specific point?
What other products (if any) on the market offer the same (or similar) benefits?

If you’re up against competing products, why would your persona choose to buy from you, rather than one of your competitors? Think about your USPs; specifically, how your USPs will benefit your buyer.
What questions will they ask before deciding to buy your product? This might include:
What’s their number one concern when deciding whether or not to make a purchase? (Price, quality, brand, etc.)
How would they prefer to purchase your product? Online, over the phone, or in person?
Are they willing to make the purchase by alternative means, or is there only one means by which they are happy or able to buy?
When making a purchase online, which payment method do they prefer to use? Think PayPal, debit card, or credit card, but consider the card provider too.
When making a purchase in person, do they prefer to pay by card or with cash?
What accomplishments are you most proud of?
What are the top three things on your bucket list?
What value is typically associated with your industry?
What is the preferred type of sales experience in your industry?
(If a customer) Why did you choose [your company] over another company?
(If not a customer) Why did you choose X Company over us?
What is your decision-making process when planning on buying [your product/service]?
Was anyone else involved in this process? If so, who? And why or why not?
What would you say influences your purchasing decision the most?
What is most important to you when selecting a vendor?
What are some key factors that would deter you from making a purchase?
What kind of customer- or user-related decisions you make?
What are the goals you're trying to achieve?
Why are these goals important?
What steps are you taking to achieve these goals?
If it didn't, what would you do differently next time?
Who is involved in the buying process for products or services like ours?
Who do you consult with and trust for advice and information?
What are your biggest complaints about our product or service?
What must happen for you to overcome these complaints?
What is your income?
What is your current occupation?
What city do you live in? Work in?
What is their name?
Are they male or female?
Which country were they born in?
Which city were they born in?
What’s their racial background?
In which country and city do they live now?
What websites or publications do you read regularly?
Where do you go to learn about a product or service?
Who do you ask for product/service recommendations?
What type of online or print information articles do you read?
Which social media networks do you use personally? How often?
Which search engine do you use the most? What’s your process for finding something online?
Do you belong to any social, professional or networking groups?
Do you attend any industry events, conferences or trade shows?
What information formats do you engage with the most?
How do you do your research on new products and/or services for your business?
How did you find out about our company?
How adept are they at using technology?
Do they tend to embrace new technologies or do they prefer to stick with systems they know?
Are they a fluent internet user?
What operating system do they use?
What internet browser do they use?
Which is their preferred search engine?
Do they use any social media websites?
Do they use their cell phone for browsing the internet?
Do they use their cell phone to make purchases?
What is your HHI?
Are you a homeowner or renter?
What do you do for fun?
Who are the people in your life that are most important?
What type of vehicles do you own and why?
What type of indulgent or luxurious purchases do you make?
Do you have any hobbies? Are you involved in any activities or organizations?
Tell us about your family life.
Who were they raised by (mother and father/single parent/grandparents/etc)?
If applicable, what did their mother do for a living?
Again, if applicable, what did their father do for a living?
Alternatively, if they weren’t raised by their mother or father, what did their primary caregiver do for a living?
What was the parenting style they were raised with? Strict, laid back, or somewhere in between?
Were they raised in a religious household? If yes, which religion were they raised under?
Do they have any brothers or sisters? If yes, how many brothers and how many sisters?
Where in the birth order did they arrive? (This is said to have a significant impact on the kind of person we grow up to be).
What was the social status of their family growing up?
Did they grow up in the city, the suburbs, or in a rural area?
What type of home did they grow up in? (An apartment, small house, large house, etc.)
Do they have any debt? How much?
Is this debt (if there is any) a result of the cost of necessary landmarks in their life (i.e. a college loan or a mortgage) or irresponsible spending (such as credit card debt)?
How much are they worth (total cash and assets, minus liabilities)?
Are they very conscientious about the purchases they make or are they liable to make impulse buys?
Are they the main breadwinner in their household?
Are they responsible for most of the purchasing decisions in their household?
How do they feel about their current marital status? Happily single or happily married? Or, are they single but looking for a partner?
What’s their sexual orientation?
Which political party (if any) do they support?
Are they actively involved in politics?
Are they environmentally conscious?
Which news sources do they read?
Also if yes, are they girls, boys, or a mix of both?
If they don’t have children, is this a conscious decision or do they want children but have been unable to have them? Are they likely to have children in the future?
Do they have any pets?
If yes, how many and what are they? Interestingly, people’s preferences towards particular animals can tell us a lot about their character.
What type of home do they currently live in?
Who (if anyone) shares their home with them?
How many friends do they have? Explore this further by asking how many close friends they have vs. more casual acquaintances.
Do they see their friends often? Are they a social butterfly or do they prefer spending their free time at home?
Are they religious?
If yes, which religion are they part of?
Also if yes, have they always been part of this religion or is something they chose to embrace as an adult?
What hobbies (if any) do they have?
Do they exercise regularly?
If yes, what type/s of exercise do they do?
If no, why don’t they exercise? Time? Laziness? Health problems?
Do they play any competitive sports?
Do they prefer baths or showers? Seriously – the answer says more about us than you might think.
What TV shows do they enjoy watching?
What genre of movies do they like best?
What genre of movies do they like least?
What type of music do they enjoy listening to?
Who do they most look up to/admire? This could be somebody they know, or a celebrity.
Do they enjoy reading?
If yes, what do they tend to read?
Do they regularly go on vacations?
If yes, where do they go? Do they usually go to the same place? Do they go abroad?
Also if yes, what do sort of vacations do they usually go on? Beach? City? Skiing? Cruise?
If they don’t go on many vacations, why not? Does money hold them back or do they simply prefer staying at home?
Have they ever been backpacking?
If yes, where did they go?
Also if yes, who did they go with?
If no, do they ever want to go traveling?
How often do they treat themselves?
Do they drink alcohol?
Do they smoke?
If no to either of the above, are they an ex-drinker or smoker?
Are they introverted or extroverted? Or somewhere inbetween?
How spontaneous are they?
Are they a risk taker?
Do they tend to break or follow rules?
Are they mostly optimistic or pessimistic? Or are they a realist?
Are they driven more by their right brain or their left brain? Are they more creative or more logically minded?
Do they adapt easily to change?
Are they independent or do they tend to follow the crowd?
Do they get jealous easily or are they easily pleased for others?
Do they worry about what others think of them?
How would their friends describe them?
How would they describe themselves?
What technical and demographic information do you have about your website visitors?
How do you currently market?
Describe marketing campaigns that have been the most successful.
Describe marketing campaigns that have failed.
Which blog posts have received the most traffic?
What are the most frequently asked questions from customers?
Which page on the website receives the most impressions?
What is the most frustrating part of your day?
What is the worst customer service experience you’ve ever had?
What regular activity do you find stressful?
What makes you nervous?
What is the fastest way for somebody to make you angry?
What is your least favorite part of your job?
What is the worst job you can imagine?
What purchase under XX dollars did you most regret?
What do you worry about?
What frustrates you the most about your job?
What do you enjoy most?
What types of customers do you typically meet?
Why do different types of customers typically make a purchase?
What reasons do customers cite for selecting your business over a competitor?
What are the most common objections you hear?
Were they popular at school?
What type of school did they attend? Public or private? Small or large? Was it a well-rated and respected school or a struggling school?
What were they like at school? Were they popular? A loner? Somewhere in between?
What “social group” (if any) did they fit into?
How well did they do at school? Did they tend to fail, excel, or were they an average student?
Did they get into much trouble at school?
What was their favorite subject?
What was their least-favorite subject?
What did they want to be when they were growing up?
Did they go to college?
If so, which one?
Without wanting to repeat myself, which extra-curricular activities (if any) did they take part in at college?
Did they join a sorority or fraternity?
What was their social life like at college?
What kinds of grades did they get?
If they didn’t go to college, what stopped them? Cost? Grades? Or did college simply not fit with their goals?
If they didn’t go to college, what did they do after high school? Get their first job? Go traveling? Nothing?
What is their current literacy level?
What are your career goals?
What are your responsibilities in that role?
What industry (or industries) is the company a part of?
What does success in your job look like to you?
What are some of your biggest priorities when making decisions for the company?
What are the company’s short- and long-term objectives?
How long have you been in your current position?
What does a typical day look like for you?
How much time do you spend at work and at home?
What are the top questions asked by customers?
What are the top questions asked by prospects?
Take me back to the day when you first decided to explore your [product/service] options. What was going on in your life that made you think about making this purchase?
How did you hear about [your company]?
What initially attracted you to us?
What was your first impression of us?
Were you the main person doing research when you found us? If not, who was?

What 3 words would you have used to describe [your company] while you were comparing other companies? (If you don’t mind me asking, what words would you have used to describe the other companies you were evaluating?)
What was your biggest concern or reservation (if any) about buying from us?
Describe your career path.
What is your job role? Your title?
How is your job measured?
What does a typical day look like?
What knowledge and which tools do you use in your job?
What are you responsible for?
What does it mean to be successful in your role?
How do you learn about new information for your job?
Which publications or blogs do you read?
Which associations and social networks do you participate in?
What are your general job objectives?
What kind of customer or user information do you need?
What analytics information are you currently using?
What kind of customer- or user-related questions are currently not answered using the available data?
How would you use personas in your own work?
What information you find useful in a persona profile?
(OPTIONAL: What information is missing from the shown persona profile?)
What was their first full-time job?
How did they end up where they are today?
Has their career track been traditional or did they switch from another industry?
How often you buy high ticket items?
How much are they worth?
Are they responsible for making purchasing decision in the household?
What’s important to them and what’s driving the change?
What’s impeding or speeding their need to change?
How do they go about change?
What do they need to know to embrace change?
Who do they turn to for advice or information?
What’s the value they visualize once they make a decision?
Who do they have to sell change to in order to get it?
What could cause the need for this change to lose priority?
What is your job title?
What are your responsibilities?
What is a typical workday like for you?
How many years of experience do you have?
What is your professional background?
How do you measure success in your position?
To whom do you report? Who reports to you?
What was their first ever job (remember that this may overlap with school or college)?
What was their first ever full-time job?
What job are they currently doing?
How long have they been in their current role?
Why did they choose this job? Were they head-hunted? Or perhaps the role is a stop-gap until they find something more suited to their skill set?
What are their key responsibilities?
How much do they earn?
Do they feel their current salary offers fair compensation for the work they do?
Do they enjoy their job?
Do they like the people they work with?
Do they like their boss?
What, if anything, would they change about their current role?
How do they see their role progressing? Will they be looking to move to another company or progress within their current firm?
Are they considering a career change?
What is their dream job?
Do they have any plans to pursue their dream job?
